net.beaconcontroller.util

Class LongShortHopscotchHashMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.beaconcontroller.util.LongShortHopscotchHashMap

  • public class LongShortHopscotchHashMap
extends Object
    This is a custom implementation of Hopscotch Hashing as initially written: Maurice Herlihy, Nir Shavit, and Moran Tzafrir. 2008. Hopscotch Hashing. In Proceedings of the 22nd international symposium on Distributed Computing (DISC '08). This Map supports only a key of primitive long type, with value of primitive short type. Internally it is a single array of longs, with an overhead of 6 bytes per entry, which is much less than the observed HashMap overhead per entry. Internal array layout [key 8 bytes][value 2 bytes | pad 2 bytes | hop_info 4 bytes], [key 8 bytes][value 2 bytes | pad 2 bytes | hop_info 4 bytes]..
    Author:
    David Erickson (daviderickson@cs.stanford.edu)

      • murmur32

        public static int murmur32(int[] data,
           int seed)
        Modified version of the Murmur hash 2.0. Originally retrieved from http://d3s.mff.cuni.cz/~holub/sw/javamurmurhash/, modified by David Erickson. Note this modified version is hard coded to accept two integers in an array, ie a long converted to two ints. Original comments below: The murmur hash is a relative fast hash function from http://murmurhash.googlepages.com/ for platforms with efficient multiplication. This is a re-implementation of the original C code plus some additional features. Public domain.
        Parameters:
        data -
        seed -
        Returns:
